head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Risk Of Heat Waves Rising With Emissions

identified-content.org: Hadley Center for Climate Prediction and Research

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Risk Of Heat Waves Rising With Emissions

abstract.p: Oxford University and Hadley Center for Climate Prediction and Research team predicts in journal Nature that global buildup of greenhouse gas emissions has at least doubled chance that Europe will have another record-breaking heat wave this summer (S)

block.p: The global buildup of heat-trapping emissions from smokestacks and tailpipes appears to have at least doubled, and probably raised fourfold, the chances that Europe will be struck by an extremely hot summer like the one that caused more than 20,000 premature deaths last year, scientists reported. Writing in the journal Nature, a team from Oxford and the Hadley Center Center for Climate Prediction and Research in Britain said it got the result in part by comparing computer simulations of the last 100 years of climate with and without the extra ''greenhouse'' gases.
